flawed_nl_solution:
A full year has 12 months. So 2 years is 2*12 = <<2*12=24>>24 months
The loan amount is $6000 that he will repay in 24 months so 6000/24 = $<<6000/24=250.0>>250.0 per month
If he paid his dad back in 5 years that 5*12 = <<5*12=60>>60 months
$6000 loan spread out over 60 months is 6000/60 = $<<6000/60=10.0>>10.0 per month
To pay it off in 2 years instead of 5, Gary is paying 250.0-10.0 = $<<250.0-10.0=240.0>>240.0 more per month

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 100.0, not 10.0. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
